The story plot is really nice and definitely something that I'm not going to forget any time soon. It has a lovely ending, which almost got me crying. The graphics are amazing and run perfectly on my device. The multiplayer mode can lag a little if your internet is slow. A friend gifted me this game back when it was on sale and costed less than 1‚Ç¨. If I could go back in time and try declining this gift of his, I would look for this game again and pay it full price. It's really worth it. Some puzzles took a while to understand, but I found it so satisfying when I got the solution. It can take a while, all it takes is just some patience, really, and the plot of the story makes you never want to stop playing. I wish there were more chapters, but for now multiplayer will do the thing. This game is really good. Hey, if you're reading this and still not bought the game, and you're looking for a great, addicting, good-looking, solo and multiplayer game... Buy it now. It's worth each penny.

Definitely a classic! Much better (and longer) than the first installment. The game probably has replay value in 2020, but I don't have it installed at the moment. I do remember that some of the courses actually requires you to use your brain to get through some of them and it's quite entertaining to say the least. I'd recommend this game for the price as is, or on sale, because either way it's a steal for how great of a puzzle game this is. 

10/10 would recommend again and again...
